title.narrative: WASH SYSTEMS STRENGTHENING

description.narrative: Enhanced enabling environment for Water, Sanitation, and Hygiene (WASH) focusing on accountability/sustainability/policy, advocacy, evidence generation and use by 2018, which contributes to Environmental Sustainability, Sanitation, Wash â€“ General, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: 3.0 Improved and equitable use of safe drinking water, sanitation and healthy environment and improved hygiene practices

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Enhanced enabling environment for WASH focusing on accountability/sustainability/policy, advocacy, evidence generation and use by2018

description.narrative: The Minister of Water Resources launched the UNICEF-supported integrated digital monitoring system, the official WASH monitoring and evaluation platform for Sierra Leone, enabling the Ministry to improve generation and use of evidence in planning and policy. UNICEF co-led the coordination of the WASH pillar during 2019 flooding, and UNICEF contributed to Urban Wash Strategy and WASH sector policy review, supporting the Government to develop a more accountable and equitable enabling environment for WASH service delivery. | Status:Met | As-of Date:05/02/2020
